content.question: Trial <math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></math> Absorbance 1 0.025 0.124 2 0.050 0.268 3 0.100 0.520 4 0.150 0.680 Using a spectrophotometer, a student measures the absorbance of four solutions of <math alttext="C u S O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CuSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at a given wavelength. The collected data is given in the table above. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for the discrepant data in trial 4 ?

choices.label: The solution was at a lower temperature than the solutions in the other trials.
The measurement was made using a different spectrophotometer that uses a cell with a longer path length.
The solution was saturated and the flow of light through the solution was restricted.

The concentration of the solution was actually lower than <math alttext="0.150 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.150</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The concentration of the solution was actually lower than <math alttext="0.150 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.150</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.E: Identify or describe potential sources of experimental error.
